data.title: More OpenGL cleanups
data.body: This merges the separate ErrorHandler class into OpenGL and reorganizes the OpenGL init code to be more sane and extendable.  The `GLFeatures` can be used by future PRs to optionally enable better/faster implementations on systems that support them.

data.title: Update the default NUnit from 2.6.4 to 3.0.1
data.body:
The older version of NUnit seems to have trouble running, at least on Ubuntu 15.10 and recent versions of Mono.

With this update, `make dependencies` followed by `make nunit` works out of the box for me.

data.title: .net Framework Initiation Error: Unable to find a version of the runtime to run this application.
data.body:
Screenshot attached; my PC is of Windows XP.
![qq 20151227043144](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16450943/12009720/58c78b28-ac52-11e5-8cd8-6a476b88782e.png)

Sorry if this is a dummy question, but .. I tried searching the keywords, and found nothing in the repository. My questions are:
1. Is OpenRA supposed to be run independently, or merged into the existing C&C / RA1 / etc directory?
2. Since I'm still using the antiquated XP, I don't need to run in compatible mode right? OpenRA is not something created under Win98, I guess?
3. I don't see any setup or settings file to run ahead -- except for the OpenRA.Game.exe.config which contains some html voodoo that I have no clue of manipulating.

Thanks ahead!

data.title: Standardising tiles across theatres
data.body:
So I learned today that (for the RA mod at least, and between snow and temperate) changing the theatre manually in the yaml within the oramap will do a very good job of converting all the tiles and actors to the correct theatre. Missing tiles are simply rendered as black squares.

I am planning to add some of these missing tiles with their equivalents from other theatres (where appropriate). The tiles that need new/adjusted artwork I was thinking of duplicating with a similar existing tile already in that tileset. This would allow artistic contributors to change the artwork in future while keeping yaml code changes to a minimum (if any).

In the long term though, I _think_ this could evolve into a theatre selection option in the map lobby. Perhaps with a random default setting. Throw in a small chance to have the new weather effects play for each theatre and you have a way to make all maps seem a little different each time.

Is this actually realistic though?

data.title: Missiles often crash prematurely
data.body:
When shooting north (facing 0), missiles quite often make a sharp curve to the right and explode, sometimes several cells before the target. Other directions don't seem to be affected.

Introduced by #8717 or one of its follow-ups (#9646, #9746).
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29424547-missiles-often-crash-prematurely-when-flying-north?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Reworking ReplayRecorderConnection to be not be a Connection
data.body:
I made it so that the ReplayRecorder is no longer a connection itself but a component of certain connections. This allows one to keep a connection but create a new Replay by disposing of the old one and then starting a new one. 

This also removes a large amount of complexity from the recorder which was mostly forwarding to an actual connection and modifying some functions

Terrain, ore, trees and debris

-The terrain and ore adjusted
-The additional trees and islands (and some more minor adjustments)

I think the additional trees and debris added (sparingly) make a huge difference, but awaiting feedback before I squash.

data.title: Polish the chronoshiftpower on the map Bomber John
Replace MiniTK.Audio with OpenAL-CS and update to latest SDL2-CS.
data.body:
This removes our last hard dependency on the legacy OpenTK code.

I have forked https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenAL-CS because according to @Mailaender the upstream author does not want the library to be included in nuget.

data.title: Balanced 1v1 maps in the offical pool
data.body:
In the RA1 mod particularly, we ship many 1v1 maps that I feel are not balanced. Although competitive maps are trickling into the resource centre and are slowly being added to the official pool, we have had a number of competitive tournaments where official maps have been used.

I think we should update some of the more unbalanced maps to match our current drive of unit balancing. At the same time, I think we should also increase the aesthetics of the much older maps.

I am _not_ suggesting that maps should be redone to be perfectly symmetrical or such. I do feel however that oRA's gameplay has evolved over time to provide some unique gameplay mechanics and quirks that now cause issues on some maps.

-Base walking to initial ore patches within CY build radius
-Ore mine distance to REFs, accounting for northern REF disadvantage
-Distances to expansions, attack range distances and tech buildings

I will be creating some PR's to show off some changes I am proposing to remedy this. This is more of an announcement to get peoples thoughts on the idea. 

As always suggestions are welcome. And testing.
- [x] Add various community maps #10320
- [x] Singles #10301
- [x] Man to Man #10312 
- [x] Kotg 2 #10347

data.title: OpenRA lagging, very slow in Skirmish/Singleplayer
data.body:
Hello everyone,

I am playing OpenRA, mostly in Skirmish mode on my own maps, normal size 128x128 or 256x256. The game is lagging massively.

Here is a screenshot showing the performance graphs and a copy of the perf.log of the currently running game:

![screenshotopenrawithlags](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16452503/12010459/31f44a76-aca8-11e5-9152-b77b9df21064.png)

[perf - Kopie.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/72690/perf.-.Kopie.zip)

Kind regards,
Carst

Sorry, edit, I forgot my PC details:
i7-2700K @ 3.5Ghz
16GB of RAM
64-bit Win10
GeForce GTX580
Computer is running well in all other games and programs. I can play games like GTA5 at near max settings, just for reference.

data.title: Allow AUD file with sample rates other than 22050 Hz
data.body: Fixes #10283.

data.title: Replace MiniTK.Graphics with custom OpenGL shim.
data.body:
This replaces the ~30k line monster that's hidden in our custom sdl2-cs.dll with a minimal shim that only exposes the functionality that we actually need and uses the proper c-style conventions.  This removes the relatively long delay (at least on my machine) between window creation and first render, and gets us a step closer to being able to use the "official" sdl2-cs library.

Depends on #10249 which currently makes up the first 6 commits in this pr (don't review these here!).

data.title: Allow building on ore fields
data.body: When a structure is built on cells containing ore, the ore could be destroyed or transferred to the rest of the ore patch.

data.title: Selling Refinery in D2K causes loss of money/spice
data.body:
If you sell your refineries or silos in D2K you first get money back and then it goes down seemingly because there was money "stored" in the refinery or silo. This doesn't matter how much you have just how much entered said structure. So if you take the money you get and spend it all, and then allow your harvester to collect spice and the sell your refinery you will be left with a small amount of money, in testing about 25% of the money acquired.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29407791-selling-refinery-in-d2k-causes-loss-of-money-spice?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Main menu not showing up
data.body:
When I open the game the loading screen comes up. Then I here the sounds of the main menu and it seems that I can click on menu items because I can here the sounds but the menu screen doesn't show up and I'm stuck in the loading screen.

Tried with version 20151224 and with the current bleed branch (commit 7335c4a8ce47c1b50eb844423d117c3be4cf8caf).

OS is Archlinux, Kernel 4.3.3, Intel grafics.

`debug.log` has 15000 entries of `Could not find collection 'dialog'`. All other logs are empty or contain normal stuff.

data.title: Dump Mono.NAT in favor of Open.NAT 2
data.body:
https://github.com/lontivero/Open.NAT/wiki/Why-Open.NAT

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7140.
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8794.
Depends on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10279.

It also deprecates the `Settings.Server.NatDeviceAvailable` helper variable and always logs into `nat.log` (so we can get rid of `Settings.Server.VerboseNatDiscovery` as well) as even in verbose mode it is now pretty readable as Open.NAT only searches for NAT devices, not every other UPnP enabled device in the network.
